topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53da87e46368726472400000#post_53da87e46368726472400000
Long explanation short: social upbringing combined with lack of experience.

What I mean by this is that if a person is never taught something then they won't understand why it's a bad idea.   To quote Einstein everyone is a genius in their own way, but on the reverse token everyone is stupid in their own way; the question is much lack of experience do they have and to what extent were they never taught critical thinking in certain situations.
